intro: Pleocnemia dimidiolobata, commonly known as the two-lobe pleocnemia, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its distinctive two-lobed leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, tropical environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
